definition: abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province

sentences.chinese: 万古长青的理性的纪念物。

sentences.english: They symbolize the everlasting friendship between the Chinese and Myanmar peoples and the Buddhist exchange between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 象征中泰两国人民友谊和佛教交往万古长青。

sentences.english: The great man's name will be ever new in the history.
sentences.chinese: 伟人的名字在历史将万古长青。

sentences.english: My love shall in my verse ever live young.
sentences.chinese: 我的爱在我诗里将万古长青。

sentences.english: Like pines and cypresses, his qualities are forever great.
sentences.chinese: 他高尚的品格好比苍松翠柏，万古长青。

sentences.english: Make it last forever friendship never ends.
sentences.chinese: 使之万古长青的友谊永远不会结束。

sentences.english: May the friendship between the peoples of (our) two countries last forever.
sentences.chinese: 祝两国人民的友谊万古长青。

sentences.english: Next year, my life will last forever.
sentences.chinese: 明年我的生命就可以万古长青。

definition: to become more resolute with the passing of time (idiom)
high as the mountain and long as the river (idiom); fig. noble and far-reaching
deep roots and vigorous foliage (idiom)/(fig.) well established and growing strongly
lit. although dead, as if still alive (idiom); still with us in spirit
the fabled roc flies ten thousand miles (idiom)/one's future prospects are brilliant
may you enjoy boundless longevity (idiom)/long may you live
pine and cypress/fig. chaste and undefiled/fig. tomb
(of one's name, reputation etc) to be immortalized (idiom)/to leave a mark for generations to come
to grow and multiply without end
